newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan interbank rate ends lower, seen rising.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan interbank rate ends lower, seen rising.

text.p: Taiwan's interbank rate finished slightly lower on Monday but dealers said they expected the rate to rise on Tuesday on tightening liquidity.
The overnight interbank rate closed at 5.407 percent against Saturday's 5.421 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 5.15-5.20 percent against 5.25.
Dealers said routine monthly payroll demand would drive the money rates higher in the near term.
The bond market reported no trade in the afternoon.
Government bond yields eased in morning trade shortly after the government announced a lower-than-expected rise in the consumer price index for December.

The consumer price index was up 2.52 percent in December compared to December 1995, bringing the full-year 1996 CPI rise to 3.07 percent, the Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics said.
